climbs.name: C'est pas la mer à Ciboire

content.description:
P1 (70m, WI3+) This part can be snowy and therefore tricky to stay on the path of least resistance. I recommend to skip this pitch by hiking the snow to the left and then back right to the base of the money pitch.

Otherwise, climb a narrow flow of ice, in a shallow dihedral in the center of the slab, just under the vertical wall.

P2 (50m, WI5, R) Follow ice formations to the base of the complex steep part. The second part is balancy and probably different each season. You have to maneuver to get right on a steep column. The protections will probably be better in this portion.

Belay from a birch tree with slings an rap rings left a few meters from the step.



Head straight toward the stalactites through the forest and the scree, from the path along the river. About 35 minutes.

Ice Screws

P1 (WI4, 60m) Follow an obvious narrow flow of ice that can be thin in parts.

P2 (WI2, 60m) Go straight up the ice to the base of the money pitch.

P3 (WI5, 20m) Climb mushroom and amazing feature.



The wide most obvious ice flow north of The Triolet. Approach from Draveur visitors center brought the path west of the river in about 35m. 

Ice Screws

Climb a delicate, less than vertical, face traversing right to gain a ledge with a huge flake on it. Climb on the top of the flake, place a cam and get onto the ice (crux). Follow 20m of ice to the top of the cliff.



This line is located above the 120m line "C’est pas la mer à Ciboire" (WI5). After topping out that one out, follow a snowy slab for 50m to reach the bottom for bottom of the climb which has a fixed anchor with rap rings. 

Bolts, Screws and a 3/8" cam

Le Triolet is an area located on the west of the Malbaie river. It has a few major climbs with different sun aspect. The north most walls are facing north-east and the most south ones are facing south. It is therefore possible to climb there is different weather scenarios. The most popular climbs are Le Triolet (WI5) and Hystérie Collective (WI5).
